title.narrative: OUTPUT 3: CHILD PROTECTION REFFERAL SYSTEMS IN DEVELOPMENTAL AND EMERGENCY SITUAT

description.narrative: By 2022, at least three provinces and one territory establish effective mechanisms to receive, monitor and investigate reports of cases of child abuse, including referral where necessary in developmental and emergency situations.

sector.narrative: Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse

title.narrative: Pakistan United Nations Development Assistance Framework

UNICEF Programmes in Pakistan (Emergencies Disaster Risk Reduction)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, at least three provinces and one territory establish effective mechanisms to receive, monitor and investigate reports of cases of child abuse, including referral where necessary in developmental and emergency situations.

description.narrative: UNICEF provided technical support to the governments of Balochistan and GB to implement their respective CRC-aligned child protection legislations, supporting the establishment of child protection case management and referral systems and strengthening capacities of existing structures and the social service workforce to respond effectively to child abuse cases. Legislative reforms are ongoing in Sindh and KP to align their existing CP legislations with CRC. A partnership with the National Commission on Human Rights and Parliamentary Committee on Child Rights was strengthened to conduct and validate a child rights legislative review for compliance with CRC and its Committee's Recommendations for CRC@30 | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: # of children and adults (with segregation by age, gender, demographic location) provided with prevention or response interventions and services to address their mental health and psychosocial support needs,

baseline.value: 17,46 patients including 572 women, 498 men, 304 boys and 372 girls,

actual.value:
2019:4,645
Comprising 1,860 children (776 girls, 1,084 boys) and 2,785 adults (1,473 women, 1,312 men)

baseline.value: CP Act 2015 (Balochistan) fully aligned with CRC,

actual.value:
2019:CRC-aligned CP draft bills submitted to Government of Sindh and KP,
CP-CMRS design finalized and validated in Balochistan and GB CPIMS assessment completed in Balochistan to inform the CPIMS design
Training Plan finalized in Balochistan and GB on CP-CMRSS in KP
